text: How do we define Code Quality?
Does anyone have a reasonable definition of Code Quality?
I don't think there is a good definition, and I see plenty of bad definitions.
There are many definitions for Correctness, but I would expect correctness to be a given, and quality is meaningless if the code is broken.
I suspect quality is something like:

code:
correctness               AND spec-conformant AND
clever                    AND not-too-clever  AND
simple                    AND not-too-simple  AND
uses-sensible-algorithms  AND
does-not-reinvent-wheel   AND
uses-appropriate-language AND
lacks-bad-smells          AND
concise                   AND
clear                     AND
well-documented           AND
with-good-performance     AND
elegant                   AND not-baroque

text: Does anyone have any better definitions?
